meanings.definition: A drink poured out as an offering to a deity.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the priest poured a libation of water onto the ground.
meanings.sent2: In ancient times, people would offer a libation of wine to the gods.
meanings.sent3: The libation of milk for the spirits seemed to please the guests at the party.
meanings.sent4: The libation of tea symbolized harmony and respect in their culture.
meanings.sent5: The sweet aroma of the libation filled the temple with a sense of reverence.

meanings.definition: The act of pouring a drink as a ceremonial gesture.
meanings.sent1: As a sign of respect, she performed the libation before the meal.
meanings.sent2: The libation of sake marked the beginning of the traditional ceremony.
meanings.sent3: His exaggerated libation of juice made everyone smile at the event.
meanings.sent4: The libation of cider flowed gracefully into the cup, a symbol of unity.
meanings.sent5: The libation of honey was a sweet gesture to honor their friendship.
